MC.content: symptōma in Greek, first meant sinking, depression, then meant coincidence, event, finally meant sign, illness [finitude]
MC.linkedContent: symptōma in Greek, first meant sinking, depression, then meant coincidence, event, finally meant sign, illness [finitude]

HASD.content: [in absolutely singular logic] “God” names that without which one could not account for any negativity: grammatical or logical negation, illness, evil and neurosis
HASD.linkedContent: [in absolutely singular logic] “God” names that without which one could not account for any negativity: grammatical or logical negation, illness, evil and neurosis

HASD.content: instead of reducing religion to symptom [in this logic], the symptom would be a negative manifestation of God
HASD.linkedContent: instead of reducing religion to symptom [in this logic], the symptom would be a negative manifestation of God

HASD.content: deconstruction: a “symptom” of modern/postmodern nihilism or last testimony of faith, martyrdom, in the present fin de siècle?
HASD.linkedContent: deconstruction: a “symptom” of modern/postmodern nihilism or last testimony of faith, martyrdom, in the present fin de siècle?

MPM.content: de Manian criticism/deconstruction always analysis of “resistances” and symptoms they produce [i.e. “resistance to theory” in literary studies]
MPM.linkedContent: de Manian criticism/deconstruction always analysis of “resistances” and symptoms they produce [i.e. “resistance to theory” in literary studies]

PP.content: King-Ra says writing only cures the symptom, writing belongs to the exteriority of the symptom
PP.linkedContent: King-Ra says writing only cures the symptom, writing belongs to the exteriority of the symptom

S.content: Heidegger’s avoidance of Geist as symptomatic foreclosure

FSW.content: against Freud?: a rigorous determination of the anomaly [symptom?] is impossible
FSW.linkedContent: against Freud?: a rigorous determination of the anomaly [symptom?] is impossible

F.content: 2 routes (both angular) (double density) the Thing follows at dividing line (the Thing marked by same dividing line as symbol broken by crypt): 1) crosses unconscious directly (tableau, symptom) 2) crosses intrasymbolic crack (alloseme)
F.linkedContent: 2 routes (both angular) (double density) the Thing follows at dividing line (the Thing marked by same dividing line as symbol broken by crypt): 1) crosses unconscious directly (tableau, symptom) 2) crosses intrasymbolic crack (alloseme)

FWT.content: symptoms of “secret” always return: not necessarily [re: letter always arrives]
FWT.linkedContent: symptoms of “secret” always return: not necessarily [re: letter always arrives]

FWT.content: can you prosecute someone who is only showing symptoms of racism? can one judge a symptom?
FWT.linkedContent: can you prosecute someone who is only showing symptoms of racism? can one judge a symptom?

FWT.content: [re: murder of the father] Freud’s “historical” vs. “material” truth: one based on facts in real archive, the other discernible in symptoms [Yerushalmi neglects the latter]
FWT.linkedContent: [re: murder of the father] Freud’s “historical” vs. “material” truth: one based on facts in real archive, the other discernible in symptoms [Yerushalmi neglects the latter]

POOF.content: [even if Nietzsche announces, calls for, texts by Bataille, Nancy, Blanchot, reading these texts as symptom-effects remains crude] reading not simply limited by reading in the language that the symptom-effect speaks [follow other traces] > otherwise, “reality” and “history” one distinguishes would remain undetermined & imaginary: i.e. the discourse of those ‘realistic’ champions of historical referent & actuality (effectivité)
POOF.linkedContent: [even if Nietzsche announces, calls for, texts by Bataille, Nancy, Blanchot, reading these texts as symptom-effects remains crude] reading not simply limited by reading in the language that the symptom-effect speaks [follow other traces] > otherwise, “reality” and “history” one distinguishes would remain undetermined & imaginary: i.e. the discourse of those ‘realistic’ champions of historical referent & actuality (effectivité)

POS.content: to “deconstruct” faithful/violent to philosophy, a certain textual work that produces great pleasure, a writing interested in itself that enables us to read philosophemes as symptoms (a word Derrida suspects), the symptom of thinking Being as presence [via Heidegger]
POS.linkedContent: to “deconstruct” faithful/violent to philosophy, a certain textual work that produces great pleasure, a writing interested in itself that enables us to read philosophemes as symptoms (a word Derrida suspects), the symptom of thinking Being as presence [via Heidegger]

POS.content: to read this symptom is not ingenious discovery of single person, is due to total transformation that can’t be called “historical,” or “worldwide” anymore)
POS.linkedContent: to read this symptom is not ingenious discovery of single person, is due to total transformation that can’t be called “historical,” or “worldwide” anymore)

ROP.content: Freud’s 5 resistances in “Inhibition, Symptom, Anxiety”, one of which is the ego benefiting from the illness, Derrida wonders by what concept of illness this could be an interesting singularity

ATIA.content: symptom means “fall,” case, coincidence, what falls due (échéance), mishap
ATIA.linkedContent: symptom means “fall,” case, coincidence, what falls due (échéance), mishap

ATIA.content: the right to speak blithely of the animal, one of the most symptomatic asinanities of the human, bêtise (of which animals are exempt by definition)
ATIA.linkedContent: the right to speak blithely of the animal, one of the most symptomatic asinanities of the human, bêtise (of which animals are exempt by definition)

ATIA.content: comparing Genesis w/ Greek myths [re: fault, nakedness] as two symptomatic translations, whose internal necessities partially overlap re: the proper of man [default in propriety]: technics, sociality, emergence out of nature, knowledge, historicity [?], subjectivity, subjugating superiority over animal

ATIA.content: Derrida points out that a certain profound humanism [that of the Old Testament?] privileged the question of the animal as that of the infinitely other
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida points out that a certain profound humanism [that of the Old Testament?] privileged the question of the animal as that of the infinitely other

ATIA.content: this silent appeal that calls from the outside, whose trace can only be disavowed w/ so many wounds, symptoms

ATIA.content: exclamation marks, acc. Rousseau, marks of irony, allegorical incredulity [for Derrida, reading Levinas, they are marks of disavowal]

WAP.content: the erection of institution betrays fragility of foundation: institution instituted against deconstructibility (reveals/deceives ground like a symptom would)

Gii.content: the way scientists or thinkers talks about animality constitutes a decisive symptom of discourse’s essential axiomatics
Gii.linkedContent: the way scientists or thinkers talks about animality constitutes a decisive symptom of discourse’s essential axiomatics

HLP.content: to lie to oneself is not “bad faith” > must account for mediatic techno-performativity and logic of phantasma (spectral), or symptomatology of unconscious
HLP.linkedContent: to lie to oneself is not “bad faith” > must account for mediatic techno-performativity and logic of phantasma (spectral), or symptomatology of unconscious

HLP.content: Derrida doesn’t believe that the effect of the lie, of betrayed veracity, remains indestructible as symptom [either way, logic of symptom can’t be contained w/in opposition good/bad faith]
HLP.linkedContent: Derrida doesn’t believe that the effect of the lie, of betrayed veracity, remains indestructible as symptom [either way, logic of symptom can’t be contained w/in opposition good/bad faith]

HLP.content: Freud treats lie as revealing symptom, avowal of another truth
HLP.linkedContent: Freud treats lie as revealing symptom, avowal of another truth

IW.content: if German-Jewish relation is a delirium, cannot be made into object (such object being an “artificial” reflection), then Cohen’s discourse on it could very well be symptom of madness it describes, but a true symptom: a truth it speaks that’s not of order of positive objectivity
IW.linkedContent: if German-Jewish relation is a delirium, cannot be made into object (such object being an “artificial” reflection), then Cohen’s discourse on it could very well be symptom of madness it describes, but a true symptom: a truth it speaks that’s not of order of positive objectivity

IW.content: channeling Cohen, logos is the région where symptom can be true, logos speaks of itself; to speak of logic, of objective knowledge, in opposition to logos, is to speak of nothing but its “logical” manifestation: perhaps there is a “meta-logic,” but not a meta-logos
IW.linkedContent: channeling Cohen, logos is the région where symptom can be true, logos speaks of itself; to speak of logic, of objective knowledge, in opposition to logos, is to speak of nothing but its “logical” manifestation: perhaps there is a “meta-logic,” but not a meta-logos

HST.content: if avowal goes through symptom rather than declaration > changes nothing of the truth [re: 2 Jewish enemies comically forgiving each other] [Rousseau in OG]
HST.linkedContent: if avowal goes through symptom rather than declaration > changes nothing of the truth [re: 2 Jewish enemies comically forgiving each other] [Rousseau in OG]

HST.content: laughter that says the truth of lying: logic of symptom always stronger than an ethics of truthfulness (véracité)
HST.linkedContent: laughter that says the truth of lying: logic of symptom always stronger than an ethics of truthfulness (véracité)

TN.content: intuitionistic-continuistic logic of immediacy as irrepressible as desire itself, as intractable as language constraints, grammatical violence > this law has to happen, symptoms will crop up [does Nancy really avoid this logic?]

TN.content: who could finish w/ this tempting postulation? [i.e. “smooth” desire]
